document_title: Carotid artery stenosis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: hep-dong-mach-canh.json_3_Method for diagnosing carotid artery stenosis
subsection_content:
To diagnose carotid artery stenosis, the doctor will first conduct an examination with a stethoscope along the carotid artery to detect a murmur at the stenosis site.
Duplex ultrasound can evaluate the degree of stenosis and the morphology of atherosclerotic plaques with thrombus or ulceration. At the same time, ultrasound also provides additional hemodynamic parameters such as peak systolic velocity at the stenosis site, which is also a standard to evaluate the degree of stenosis. This is the first choice diagnostic method because of its safety and low cost.; In addition, there are a number of other disease diagnosis methods such as CT scan or magnetic resonance angiography (MRA). These are modern techniques that not only provide images to identify stenotic lesions but can also evaluate the morphology of the entire carotid artery from its origin in the aortic arch to its branches in the brain. In addition, brain CT or MRI images also help evaluate cerebral perfusion status in cases after stroke.; Digital angiography (DSA): indicated when considering carotid artery stenting. This is considered the most accurate method of diagnosing vascular conditions, the gold standard in diagnosing vascular diseases.
